result.execSummary:
The defendant Kezia T Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Set at $1,246.56 payable to Janice G.  To be paid before Court costs.
*8/8/16 Restitution was ordered in amount of $1,246.56 payable to Janis G.    Order amended to include Crime Victim Compensation Program in amount of $1,090.27 and $123.56 to Janis G.  An overpayment in the amount of $32.73 to Janis G. wil be recouped by the Crime Victim Compensation Program.
*1/10/2017  Order amended to include the Crime Victim Compensation Program in amount of $425.00.

Pay DNA surcharge, mandatory Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.   Nonmandatory costs/surharges/assessments waived.
AS TO ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS/RESTITUTION:  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment. Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, thearpy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Janice G.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Anger management assessment.  Cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Per remittitur dated June 5, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP000663 CRNM, it is ordered and adjudged by this court in a decision filed on April 25, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is summarily affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Greogory Bates is relieved of further representing Perkins in this matter.  See. WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements made by Debora Q-S., Janice G.  Corrections to the presentence report made on the record.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS,  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $1,246.56 payable to Janice G. to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid before Court costs 
-Defendant to pay mandatory Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments, non-mandatory costs, surcharges and assessments are waived; to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Anger management assessment; cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with Janice G.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Defense request to stay commencement of sentencing pending appeal is denied.  

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Character Letters
From Kenneth & Janis Gotz received and filed.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 666
cf

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Kezia T Perkins in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Trial continued at 1:45 p.m. this date.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror #27 selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:50 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies S. Wall and J. Nell who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 4:55 p.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  State requests a Presentence Investigation Report.  Matter adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trial proceeded.  Jury panel in box.  Sworn for the State:  Janis G.   State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Colloquy conducted with defendant regarding her right to testify.  Defendant chooses to testify.  Jury in box.  Sworn for defense:  Kezia Perkins.  Defense rests.  Sworn as rebuttal:  City of Greenfield Police Officer Jeffrey Rummald.  Court recesses matter for lunch.  Trial to commence at 1:30 p.m. this date for continuation of trial.

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Trial continues.  Jury in box.  Sworn for the State:  Debra Q-S; Michelle P.  Exhibits 1-4 offer and received.  At the hour of 2:45 p.m., Court recessed trial until 9/18/15 at 8:30 a.m.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss heard and denied.

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel not in court.  Motion for Strikes for Cause proceeded.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire continued at the hour of 9:50 a.m.   Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn at 10:50 a.m.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Jury panel in box.  Sworn for the State:  City of Greenfield Police Officer Jeffrey Romuald.  Court recesses matter for the lunch hour.  Trial to continue this date at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:30 p.m.   At the hour of 4:50 p.m. matter adjourned to September 17, 2015 @ 9:00 a.m. for continuation of voir dier.

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State ready to proceed to trial.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Defendant brought her 10 month old child to Court and is unable to procure child care.   Court denies motion to adjourn.  Matter to proceed to Jury Trial at 1:30 p.m. this date.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is still in a trial the began Monday, and therefore is unable to proceed with the trial today. State does not object to an adjournment. Case adjourned to Brach 21.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Defense still in a contest posture.  Parties prepared to proceed to trial.  Defense indicates possible motion.  Defense instructed to file motion in writing by the end of this day; counsel indicated he would not.  Defense informed that today is the motion deadline and the court does not hear motions on the day of trial.  Case remains set for Jury Trial before Branch 21 on 6-24-15 at 9:00 a.m.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
submitted by Janis L. and Kenneth G., filed.

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Defense in a contest posture.  Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed in Br. 21 on or before the final pretrial date; hearing to be scheduled at the time of filing.  Motions must be heard prior to trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

*CASE HEARD WITHOUT CIRCUIT COURT FILE*
Matter before the Court for Status of counsel.  Attorney Novack recently appointed by public defenders office.  Defense awaiting discovery materials to arrive to defendant from prior counsel.  Defense requests time to review said materials upon receipt of them.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Cole J White.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court.  Defendant to report to Public Defender's Office for determination of eligibility.  Status conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Cole J White.  Ron Dague for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court. Defense Attorney Cole White not available for today's proceedings. Ron Dague for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JG

Defendant Kezia T Perkins in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defendant state she will be retaining counsel.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 22.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/12/15 @ 1:30 pm
